snippet: Striking down the Defense of Marriage Act is an urgent task for the justices in the coming term.
abstract: Editorial calls on the Supreme Court to strike down the Defense of Marriage Act in its coming term; notes that all six federal courts that have ruled on the 1996 law have found that it violates the Constitution by denying same-sex couples, who are legally married under state law, federal benefits afforded to heterosexual couples.
lead_paragraph: Striking down the Defense of Marriage Act is an urgent task for the justices in the coming term.
